uk.ac.ed.epcc.webapp.model.lifecycle

Interface ActionListener<R>

  • Type Parameters:
    R - type of target.
    All Superinterfaces:
    Targetted<R>
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    LifeCycleListener<R>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractAction, AbstractContexedAction, AbstractContextedListener, AbstractListener, ActionList, ListenerList

    public interface ActionListener<R>
extends Targetted<R>
    An object that needs to perform some cascaded operations after a trigger event takes place on a target object. The general case of this (where the event requires external actions and so may be aborted) is the LifeCycleListener.
    See Also:
    LifeCycleListener
     

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      default void action(R target)
      Called after the event has taken place (and any external actions have completed) to allow the LifeCycleListener to make/finalise corresponding changes to its own objects.
      default boolean allow(R target, boolean throw_reason)
      Does the ActionListener want to allow the event to take place.
      default java.lang.Object getWarning(R target)
      Get an optional object (usually a String or other object that can be added to display content) that should be presented to the user as warning before performing the operation.

      • Methods inherited from interface uk.ac.ed.epcc.webapp.Targetted

        getTarget

    • Method Detail

      • allow

        default boolean allow(R target,
                      boolean throw_reason)
               throws LifeCycleException
        Does the ActionListener want to allow the event to take place. This is to give the listener a chance to veto the event when it knows in advance its not capable of supporting the operation in its current state. For example veto project setup because there are no machines configured.
        Parameters:
        target - object.
        throw_reason - set to true to throw exception instead of returning boolean.
        Returns:
        boolean true if operation allowed
        Throws:
        LifeCycleException

      • action

        default void action(R target)
        Called after the event has taken place (and any external actions have completed) to allow the LifeCycleListener to make/finalise corresponding changes to its own objects.
        Parameters:
        target -

      • getWarning

        default java.lang.Object getWarning(R target)
        Get an optional object (usually a String or other object that can be added to display content) that should be presented to the user as warning before performing the operation. Usually this would be included in a confirm dialog. Confirmation might be triggered by one of the ActionListeners returning a non-null value
        Parameters:
        target -
        Returns:
        Object or null
